Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()

setController

boolean setController(MotorController controller)
Attach a motor controller to the motor. The motor and motor controller "should be in the same instance of MRL and this reference to another service should be ok. The motor controller uses this method to pass a reference of itself to the motor, to be used directly

detach

boolean detach()
detaches the motor from the motor controller

Returns:

isAttached

boolean isAttached()
reports if a motor is attached to a motor controller

move

void move(java.lang.Float power)
Move is the most common motor command. The command accepts a parameter of power which can be of the range -1.0 to 1.0. Negative values are in one direction and positive values are in the opposite value. For example -1.0 would be maximum power in a counter clock-wise direction and 0.9 would be 90% power in a clockwise direction. 0.0 of course would be stop

Parameters:
power - - new power level

moveTo

void moveTo(java.lang.Integer newPos)
moveTo moves the motor to a specific location. Typically, an encoder is needed in order to provide feedback data

Parameters:
newPos -

moveFor

void moveFor(java.lang.Float power,
             java.lang.Float duration)
moveFor move for a duration of time. Sub-second movement can be expressed as a float value. E.g. 0.01 s

Parameters:
power - with range of -1.0 <-> 0.0 <-> 1.0
duration - - in seconds

moveFor

void stopAndLock()
a safety mechanism - stop and lock will stop and lock the motor no other commands will affect the motor until it is "unlocked"
